item.ptxt: Use the same procedure for the RH and LH sides.
The procedure listed below is for the LH side.

s-1.ptxt: PRECAUTION

atten3.ptxt: After turning the ignition switch off, waiting time may be required before disconnecting the cable from the battery terminal. Therefore, make sure to read the disconnecting the cable from the battery terminal notice before proceeding with work (See page ).

s-1.ptxt: DISCONNECT CABLE FROM NEGATIVE BATTERY TERMINAL

atten3.ptxt: When disconnecting the cable, some systems need to be initialized after the cable is reconnected (See page ).

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE REAR POWER WINDOW REGULATOR SWITCH ASSEMBLY WITH REAR DOOR ARMREST BASE PANEL

s2.ptxt: Remove the screw.
Detach the 2 clips and 8 claws.
Disconnect the connector and remove the rear power window regulator switch assembly with rear door armrest base panel.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE REAR DOOR TRIM BOARD SUB-ASSEMBLY LH

s2.ptxt: Remove the screw.
Detach the 10 clips and remove the rear door trim board.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE REAR DOOR INNER GLASS WEATHERSTRIP LH

s2.ptxt: Raise the 5 claws of the rear door inner glass weatherstrip as shown in the illustration, and then remove the rear door inner glass weatherstrip from the rear door trim board.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE REAR SPEAKER ASSEMBLY

s2.ptxt: Disconnect the connector.
Put a 5 mm (0.197 in.) drill bit into a drill.
Wind tape around the drill bit approximately 4 mm (0.157 in.) from the tip of the drill as shown in the illustration.

atten3.ptxt: Tape the 4 mm (0.157 in.) drill bit to prevent the drill bit from going to deep.

s2.ptxt: Lightly press the drill against the 3 rivets, drill off the flanges of the 3 rivets and remove the front No. 1 speaker assembly.

atten2.ptxt: Be careful of the drilled rivet as it may become hot.

item.ptxt: Pressing the drill too firmly will cause the rivet to turn and result in the rivet not being drilled through.
Do not pry the rivet with the drill because this may cause damage to the installation holes of the rivet or the drill bit.

s2.ptxt: Continue drilling and push out the remaining rivet fragments.
Using a vacuum cleaner, remove the rivet fragments and shavings from the inside of the door.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE REAR DOOR INSIDE HANDLE SUB-ASSEMBLY LH

s2.ptxt: Detach the claw and 2 guides as indicated by the arrows in the order shown in the illustration.
Disconnect the rear door inside locking cable and rear door lock remote control cable and remove the rear door inside handle.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE REAR DOOR NO. 2 TRIM BRACKET

s2.ptxt: Remove the 2 screws and rear door No. 2 trim bracket.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE REAR DOOR SERVICE HOLE COVER LH

s2.ptxt: Pull out the wire harness from the rear door service hole cover.
Pull out the rear door inside locking cable and rear door lock remote control cable from the rear door service hole cover, and then remove the rear door service hole cover.

atten4.ptxt: Remove any remaining butyl tape from the rear door panel.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE REAR DOOR WINDOW DIVISION BAR SUB-ASSEMBLY LH

s2.ptxt: Temporarily install the rear power window regulator switch assembly with rear door armrest base panel.
Connect the cable to the negative (-) battery terminal.
Move the rear door glass so that the rear door glass channel can be seen.
Disconnect the cable from the negative (-) battery terminal.

atten3.ptxt: When disconnecting the cable, some systems need to be initialized after the cable is reconnected (See page ).

s2.ptxt: Remove the rear power window regulator switch assembly with rear door armrest base panel.
Partially remove the rear door glass run as shown in the illustration.
Loosen the temporary bolt.

atten3.ptxt: Do not remove the temporary bolt. If the temporary bolt is removed, the rear door window division bar may fall and become damaged.

s2.ptxt: Remove the screw and bolt.
Remove the rear door window division bar together with the rear door glass run as shown in the illustration.
Remove the rear door window division bar from the rear door glass run.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE REAR DOOR GLASS RUN LH

s2.ptxt: Remove the front side of the rear door glass run.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE REAR DOOR QUARTER WINDOW GLASS LH

s2.ptxt: Remove the rear door quarter window glass.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE REAR DOOR QUARTER WINDOW WEATHERSTRIP LH

s2.ptxt: Remove the rear door quarter window weatherstrip from the rear door quarter window glass.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE REAR DOOR GLASS SUB-ASSEMBLY LH

s2.ptxt: Remove the rear door glass from the rear door window regulator assembly as shown in the illustration.

atten3.ptxt: Do not damage the door glass.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE REAR DOOR GLASS CHANNEL SUB-ASSEMBLY LH

s2.ptxt: Using a screwdriver, remove the rear door glass channel.

atten4.ptxt: Tape the screwdriver tip before use.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE REAR DOOR GLASS CHANNEL FILLER

s2.ptxt: Remove the rear door glass channel filler.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE REAR DOOR BELT MOULDING ASSEMBLY LH

s2.ptxt: Put protective tape around the rear door belt moulding.
Detach the 5 claws and remove the rear door belt moulding.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE FRONT OUTER BLACK OUT TAPE LH (w/ Black Out Tape)

atten4.ptxt: When removing the front outer black out tape, heat the rear door panel and front outer black out tape using a heat light.

atten3.ptxt: Do not heat the rear door panel or front outer black out tape excessively.

s2.ptxt: Pull back an edge of the front outer black out tape and pull it parallel to the rear door panel to remove it.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE UPPER OUTER BLACK OUT TAPE LH (w/ Black Out Tape)

atten4.ptxt: When removing the upper outer black out tape, heat the rear door panel and upper outer black out tape using a heat light.

atten3.ptxt: Do not heat the rear door panel or upper outer black out tape excessively.

s2.ptxt: Pull back an edge of the upper outer black out tape and pull it parallel to the rear door panel to remove it.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE REAR OUTER BLACK OUT TAPE LH (w/ Black Out Tape)

atten4.ptxt: When removing the rear outer black out tape, heat the rear door panel and rear outer black out tape using a heat light.

atten3.ptxt: Do not heat the rear door panel or rear outer black out tape excessively.

s2.ptxt: Pull back an edge of the rear outer black out tape and pull it parallel to the rear door panel to remove it.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE REAR DOOR WINDOW REGULATOR SUB-ASSEMBLY LH

s2.ptxt: Disconnect the connector.
Loosen the temporary bolt.

atten3.ptxt: Do not remove the temporary bolt. If the temporary bolt is removed, the rear door power window regulator may fall and become damaged.

s2.ptxt: Remove the 3 bolts and rear door power window regulator.
Remove the temporary bolt from the rear door power window regulator.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE POWER WINDOW REGULATOR MOTOR ASSEMBLY LH

s2.ptxt: Using a T25 "TORX" socket wrench, remove the 3 screws and power window regulator motor.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE REAR DOOR LOCK ASSEMBLY LH

s2.ptxt: Disconnect the connector.
Disconnect the rear door inside locking cable and rear door lock remote control cable from the clamps.
Using a T30 "TORX" socket wrench, remove the 3 screws and rear door lock.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE REAR DOOR LOCK REMOTE CONTROL CABLE ASSEMBLY LH

s2.ptxt: Remove the rear door lock remote control cable.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE REAR DOOR INSIDE LOCKING CABLE ASSEMBLY LH

s2.ptxt: Detach the 3 claws and open the cover.
Remove the rear door inside locking cable.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE REAR DOOR OUTSIDE HANDLE COVER LH

s2.ptxt: Using a T30 "TORX" socket wrench, loosen the screw and remove the rear door outside handle cover.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE REAR DOOR OUTSIDE HANDLE ASSEMBLY LH

s2.ptxt: Remove the rear door outside handle by sliding and pulling it in the direction indicated by the arrow in the illustration.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE REAR DOOR OUTSIDE HANDLE FRAME SUB-ASSEMBLY LH

s2.ptxt: Using a T30 "TORX" socket wrench, loosen the screw and remove the rear door outside handle frame.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE REAR DOOR FRONT OUTSIDE HANDLE PAD

s2.ptxt: Detach the 2 claws and remove the rear door front outside handle pad.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE REAR DOOR REAR OUTSIDE HANDLE PAD

s2.ptxt: Detach the 2 claws and remove the rear door rear outside handle pad.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE REAR DOOR PANEL CUSHION

s2.ptxt: Remove the rear door panel cushion.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE REAR DOOR WEATHERSTRIP LH

s2.ptxt: Detach the 19 clips and remove the rear door weatherstrip.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE REAR DOOR OUTSIDE MOULDING LH (w/ Outside Moulding)

atten4.ptxt: When removing the rear door outside moulding, heat the rear door panel and rear door outside moulding using a heat light.

atten3.ptxt: Do not heat the rear door panel or rear door outside moulding excessively.

s2.ptxt: Put protective tape around the rear door outside moulding.
Insert piano wire between the rear door panel and rear door outside moulding.
Tie objects that can serve as handles (for example, wooden blocks) to the piano wire ends.
Pull the piano wire and scrape off the double-sided tape that holds the rear door outside moulding to the rear door panel.

atten3.ptxt: Be careful not to damage the rear door panel.

s2.ptxt: Remove the rear door outside moulding.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE REAR DOOR CHECK ASSEMBLY LH

s2.ptxt: Remove the 3 bolts and rear door check.
